newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-OUT-OF-FAVOUR LECHKOV COULD GO ON TRANSFER LIST.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-OUT-OF-FAVOUR LECHKOV COULD GO ON TRANSFER LIST.

text.p: Yordan Lechkov has fallen a long way from the dizzy heights of a World Cup semifinal two years ago.
The Bulgarian playmaker, singled out as the chief culprit in Marseille's faltering return to the French first division, could go on the transfer list, club sources said on Saturday.
Coach Gerard Gili has dropped Lechkov from his squad in favour of Ludovic Asuar, a product of the club's nursery. Lechkov was not even on the bench for their last match.

"Asuar suits me much better in the same position. The fame of a player should not smother an emerging talent," said Gili, who steered the former European champions, relegated in 1994 for disciplinary reasons, back to the top flight last season.

Lechkov, an off-season signing from Hamburg and the biggest outfield name to come to a country stunned by a mass exodus of its leading internationals, has lost his way since a promising debut in August.
Gili said: "The door is not shut (for Lechkov). But for the moment, Asuar has passed to the front."

Lechkov lost his place when Marseille were on the verge of a crisis after two consecutive home defeats against sides lower in the table. Angry fans accused the Bulgarian and other leading players of being unworthy of the club's famous colours.
A fine home win over Monaco last week followed by a goalless draw at Cannes in midweek have put Marseille back on track without Lechkov in the side.
